text: Dennis Leonard Jackson (8 March 1932 â€“ 21 March 2014) was an English professional footballer. He played as a full back. ==Early life== Jackson was born in Birmingham, England. ==Career== In August 1949, at 17 years of age, Jackson was signed-up for the amateur team West Bromwich Albion F.C.. Three years later, he stopped his playing career to join the British Army. In June 1954, he trained with Aston Villa F.C.. On 1 October of the same year he signed professionally by Hednesford Town F.C. for the next two years. He later played for Millwall F.C. for another two seasons. Finally in 1961, he moved to Rugby Town F.C. for the next five seasons, retiring as a player in May 1966 at 34 years of age. ==Death== Jackson died at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2014 deaths Category:English footballers Category:Sportspeople from Birmingham Category:West Bromwich Albion F.C. players
title: Dennis Jackson
